Communist Party of the United States of America Records

In the early 1980s, CPUSA members responded to the need to preserve and document Party history by creating a national History Commission. This commission was tasked with gathering significant historical documents; the commission's chair Mary Licht also began recording and transcribing oral histories of Party members. Most of the material in this subseries was created or collected by Licht and Phil Bart who was also chair at one time. Licht and Bart worked closely with the Archives Commission, with which it eventually merged, as well as the Reference Center for Marxist Studies. Researchers will find a significant amount of materials that document workers' history across the United States; there are also records concerning African Americans and the CPUSA that date back to the 1930s. Some of the History Commission's meeting minutes and correspondence are also included in this subseries. Researchers may also wish to consult the Communist Party of the United States of America Oral Histories Collection (OH 065). Many of the interviews in that collection were conducted by members of the History Commission.
